original: Ljunggren, Einar Jordan Carlsson, överläkare, Göteborg, f. 16/6/96 i Trelleborg av las :läk. Carl-August L. o. Elise Key. G. 25 m. Gerd Lindvall. Barn: Thomas f. 26, med. stud., Elise 36. — Stud:ex. 13 o. med. kand. 17 i Lund, med. Hc. 22 o. med. dr 30 i Sthlm. Regnelis aman. v. Seraf :las. med. klin. 19, tf. und:läk. v. Maria sjukh. kir. avd. sex mån. 21-23, und:-läk. v. Ersta sjukh. 23-27, v. Södra BB i Sthlm 28 o. v. Maria sjukh. kir. avd. 28-33, tf. bitr. lär. i kir. fyra mån. 30-31, delvis uppeh. prof. undervisn. i kir. sex mån. 31-32, lär. v. de proped. kurs. i allm. kir. o. sjukv:tekn. v. Karol. inst. 31-33, docent i kir. där 32-36, tf. las :läk. v. Sundsvalls las. kir. avd. 33-36, las :läk. i Sollefteå 36-45, överläk. v. kir. avd. I å Sahlgrenska ’sjukh. i Gbg sed. 45. Marinläk :stip. 20-23, marinläk. av andra gr. i res. 24, av första gr. 38. Insp. f. Sollefteå samrealsk. 37-45, ordf. i Sollefteå konstfören. 37-45, led. av Deutsche Gesellsch. f. Chir., Société internat. de chir., Société frang. de chir., Assoc. internat. de chir. o. Assoc. internat. de uroloigie, Korr. led. av Società ita-liana de urologie o. Gesellsch. Reich-deutscher Urologen, av Société frang. de urologie. Skr.: ett 60-tal arb. i kir. o. urol.
translated: Ljunggren, Einar Jordan Carlsson, senior physician, Gothenburg, b. 16/6/96 in Trelleborg to doctor Carl-August L. and Elise Key. Married on 25th with Gerd Lindvall. Children: Thomas b. 26, medical student, Elise 36. — Passed final high school exam in 1913 and completed bachelor's degree in medicine in 1917 in Lund, obtained medical license in 1922 and doctorate in medicine in 1930 in Stockholm. Assistant physician at Seraf :las. medical clinic in 1919, acting assistant doctor at Maria Hospital surgical department for six months in 1921-23, assistant doctor at Ersta Hospital from 1923-27, at Södra BB in Stockholm in 1928 and at Maria Hospital surgical department from 1928-33, acting assistant professor in surgery for four months in 1930-31, partially involved in professorial teaching in surgery for six months in 1931-32, teacher at pre-medical courses in general surgery and medical technology at Karolinska Institute from 1931-33, associate professor in surgery there from 1932-36, acting senior physician at Sundsvall Hospital surgical department from 1933-36, senior physician at Sollefteå Hospital from 1936-45, senior physician in the surgical department I at Sahlgrenska Hospital in Gothenburg since 1945. Naval physician scholarship recipient from 1920-23, naval physician of second class in the reserves in 1924, of first class in 1938. Inspector at Sollefteå secondary school from 1937-45, chairman of Sollefteå Art Association from 1937-45, member of the German Society for Surgery, International Society of Surgery, French Society of Surgery, International Association of Surgery, and International Association of Urology, corresponding member of the Italian Society of Urology and Reich-German Society of Urologists, and of the French Society of Urology. Wrote about 60 articles in surgery and urology.

works.name: Approximately 60 articles in surgery and urology
